worstReview.comment: If you just want some basic lists, ToDoist will do the job... that's where it ends. As a paid task list or to do manager. It fails on too many levels. Here are a few:  No Sorting: You cannot sort your tasks into due date order. This should be one of the most basic features of any task manager. You are required to use the 7 day view for this functionality, or the web version to order them. But as soon as you add a new task, it goes to the bottom regardless of due date.  Adding Task Dates: Adding due dates to tasks using terminology rather than the date picker is almost impossible. You need to write it in the exact format ToDoist specify, otherwise it won't work. If you want to see this functionality work well, check out Remember The Milk.  Reminders: Sometimes an automatic reminder will be set for a task, sometimes it won't. Even if it is set, it's hit or miss as to whether you will actually get it.  Sub-Tasks: You have to indent tasks to add sub-tasks. This is very unintuitive and means you'll often add sub-tasks in the wrong place.  Summary: Basically it's taken me more time to work around the ToDoist functionality than it's aided me as a task manager.
worstReview.title: Lacking in many basic features, even with the premium subscription

I find this to be a very cool and nifty feature. I own a Note 8.0 tablet and it's nice to have my notes for school backed up immediately as they are made.  Also, syncs and backups work even on a Wi-Fi network without internet access (an intranet), proving that data is indeed transmitted without the cloud or servers. I highly recommend this app for those who want a "cloud-less" and secure method to backup data on their mobile devices.

bestReview.comment: I was looking for an app that synced with our (husband & mine) Google calendars for appointments, and could also easily add and view items on a “To Do” list.  This app does it!  When a To Do thought comes to my mind, it’s quick and easy to add to the Task List.  I can categorize To Do items with prefixes such as:  BUY/; CLEAN/; CALL/; ONLINE/; etc. which helps to alphabetically group items.  I initially add most items to the Task List.  Then as I look at my weekly schedule of appointments, I move possible doable items from the Task List to the Weekly Plan.  When I complete an item on the Weekly Plan, I move the item to the specific day.  I can then ‘check’ the item as complete.  At the end of the day it’s gratifying to see what I’ve accomplished!  And if I don’t get something done today, I can easily move the Task to tomorrow.  This app is a great combination of a calendar and To Do List!

The current version is much better: no more notification delays, no more inconsistencies between the score and the list of scorers, no more notifications missed when a new one comes out. Now this app does what it's supposed to do, and pretty well too, without pointless and sometimes annoying frills. My rating then rises to four stars from the two of my first review. A couple of bothersome bugs remain, though: 1. The current game minute is not the real game minute but it's simply calculated as the difference between the current time and the scheduled kick-off time: if a game starts a few minutes beyond schedule, which happens very often, the game minute is inaccurate. 2. The Italian translation of the settings is not only incomprehensible, but even outrageously ridiculous.

worstReview.comment: After ATT updated my S4 to the latest version of Android 4.3 this app quit working.  The phone now tests any new wifi connection by trying to send a few bytes of data to a server.  If this fails it disables the connection.  Since my camera is not a router it was always being disabled.  Otherwise this is a useful app that would have got 4 stars.  I normally use it as substitute for a cable release but have also used it to tag locations.  Panasonic needs to update it to temporarily disable network switching when connecting directly to a camera.  Depending on your phone there may be a work around for this problem.  On my S4 it was pretty easy to disable network switching once I figured out that was the problem but on some phones there appears to be no way to disable it.  If you have an S4 that quit working with this app sometime in February or March try this:  Go to the phones "Settings" option; Under the connection tab locate Wi-Fi; Select "Wi-Fi"; While in the Wi-Fi networks tab press the menu Button and select "Advanced;" Uncheck "Auto Network Switch";  Useful app but needs to be updated to restore reliablity.
worstReview.title: App broken by latest version of Android

Once I heard jetAudio, and its awesome sound effects options, I had to look no further. It has a setting for Hall, Stage, Room, and Stadium, and the Stadium setting set to the max gives the best "live" effect I've ever heard on a music app. I also listen to Gregorian Chants, and some of the recordings just do not have the nice acoustic echo effect, but again, set on the Stadium setting, this gives the Chant that nice reverb as if I'm in the cathedral itself. I HIGHLY recommend this app to everyone who wants to be able to control their own settings delicately. Even the basic app has just what you need for this, but don't hesitate to buy the upgraded version for support...which I'm considering doing myself!

worstReview.comment: I really want MapQuest to be a decent app.  I have issues with Google Maps, and there should be an option.  But MapQuest on Android is just too dysfunctional.  The caching is pathetic ... too many times there are blank map displays while data is loading -- that never happens with G Maps.  The address recommendations are really the worst feature -- so poorly thought out and so stupidly executed -- am I really likely to be looking up an address in California when i am holding my car standing in Delaware?  This is just moronic.  But the worst part -- and those parts are already horrible -- is just the regular address lookup and routing.  It is unreliable, buggy, and basically requires the user to take minutes to validate the address before relying on MapQuest to provide a route.  It fails more often than it succeeds -- and that means that it is essentially worthless.  If you can't rely on a mapping package to take you to the correct location when you look up an address, it is worse than just 'meh' ... this actually will lead you astray, and sometimes far, far astray.  So far, this is just a failure.  I wish it were not so.

worstReview.comment: This game seems to be an odd mix of good graphics, great music, and poor gameplay. In addition, the in-game advertising is deliberately positioned over your opponent's portrait and health bar, which makes it very difficult to get a good idea of the quality of the game.  There is a huge problem with staying alive. Health is lost permanently until you either use a health potion (which returns only about 10% of your health) or die and resurrect. Because the potions are very limited and can't be bought anywhere I've found so far, the usual option is to die and try again, which rather oddly seems to have no penalty.  You can use throwing knives to save you from melee damage, but unless you face a very slow opponent you can use only one or two of these before they are upon you. There is also a blocking parry action but, because the attacks you face are so swift, it is incredibly difficult to time your block well enough to be effective.  I think a slow heal or access to more health potions would improve this game a lot. A slower back-swing on attackers swords would help to judge the block timing better. And *please* fix the awful advertising: it is just mean to cripple the game so badly.
worstReview.title: Barely playable
worstReview.replyText: Health potions are dropped as loot from enemies and chests, randomly. Note that you can attack while running to prevent being hit by enemies and avoid manually block attacks, as the character is a rogue it shouldn't be treated like a warrior to attack and block all the attacks.

worstReview.comment: I started out years ago with ACV, and when it let me down with its instability I was excited to discover Perfect Viewer. Over the years though, PV has continued adding features, but it's reliability to just open up a CBR or CBZ and be able to read through the entire file has dropped dramatically. Now I never know if I'll actually be able to read, or if it will refuse to turn the page halfway through, or just go to a black screen at some point. Anymore I spend more time force quitting and restarting the app or my entire tablet than I do getting to read comics.   Reading from a network share sounds awesome. Too bad when I select to add a network bookshelf I just get a pop-up with a cancel button and nothing else.   I shouldn't put all the blame on PV, as over the years they've upgraded the software and I haven't upgraded my hardware to keep up. But if my Asus Transformer running 4.0.3 was perfectly capable of reading comics before, why shouldn't it still be? I only use it for Perfect Viewer, Aldiko, and Play Books. Is that too much to ask? It always has plenty of memory free, but still PV seems to run out of memory, and low memory mode, or turning off page caching don't help

bestReview.comment: As a trainer and a sportsperson, I have been looking for something that allows me to train others and see what their heart is doing without having to get them to wear a Polar watch. This app does just what I wanted. I hope in time it will allow me to store data from more than one person but till then I give this app a high^4.5... though I do appreciate that you can export the data.   I have tried about 7 other apps including Polar's own app and this for me, a computer literate person, is by far the best for my needs. This app works with my Polar H7 but not my H6 HRM.   It clearly shows, min, avg and max heart rate... and this is very important to me. It syncs easily and holds on to the signal well.   App needs to allow user to set their own working zones and have a database to allow you to store more than one person... so I give this app 4.5 stars as it is worth it and I would happily support the maker to do more and make it even better.

bestReview.comment: In terms of addictiveness, this game may actually be a little TOO good.  I find myself regularly running my tablet's battery to death because I'm just having too much fun!  That said, it is a bit resource-intensive, which can cause problems, especially for older devices.  However, I think by far the best thing about this game is the support staff.  There are problems, which is to be expected from a brand new game, but the support staff are some of the best I've ever encountered.  Most of the problems I've encountered are minor, but they've always helped me resolve them quickly and in a courteous and professional manner.  Also, if you decide to get active on the game's official forum, you'll find that the developers regularly engage in conversation with the players, and listen to suggestions on how to make the game better.  Got to love it when the game is run by people who actually care and want you to have the most fun playing it!  Michel

One problem I've had, and I had mentioned this in my original review, is that when you're prompted to enter a name for the high score, there's no contrast - in the entry box, you're typing white letters onto a white field, making it very easy to type a wrong letter.  That problem still exists, but it's no longer a big deal for me because you've since added the date the high score was earned, and since the current date was the "name" I had been entering, problem solved.  (I type one blank space so that the actual "name" field is left blank.)  Another thing - I'd like it if the dots on the dice were a little smaller, because (at least in traditional mode) with the dice so close together it's not always easy to immediately see the number, it looks crowded.

worstReview.comment: I have to amend my previous 1 star review to help people that have dropped out mid battle and lost resources.  The good news: I noticed accidentally that if you are in a battle and wait after the server says it drops, your troops will keep fighting and you'll get to keep the resources if you wait for the battle to end on its own THEN acknowledge the reset. Also, since no one can actually stay connected long enough to do anything, no one can attack me.  The bad news: You can do nearly nothing in the game without the server dropping. Just got an ore achievement? Collect ore.....oh server dropped. Ok I'll just try again...oh server dropped. Ok I'll try something else. Upgrade barracks....oh server dropped. If you keep trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying and trying, eventually one thing will take. Then you can wait.I am not exaggerating in the slightest. I may have even understated my point a bit. About the only thing I can do in the game is wait and collect resources.

I called within 10 minutes and spent 30 minutes on the phone with a CSR who went back and forth to his manager,  just to be informed they cannot do anything about it, since the receiving party already "received" the funds. As far as I am concerned I was tricked into using their more expensive service and denied the possibility to fix it. bestReview.comment: The latest versions of QQi have really brought it into the modern age, dragging it from it's roots as an ICQ port for Chinese people into the modern WhatsApp and Line-dominated mobile world of the 21st century.   Gone are the old style graphics and logos and in has come a far cleaner, more modern interface which is a lot more intuitive than previous versions. The use of English in menus also feels like it has really undergone a change in emphasis, with the impression being now that Tencent understands that QQi is a way for QQ to grow worldwide, rather than a tool to allow the minority of English speakers to chat to Chinese friends. Gone are shoddy translations on the whole, though the odd mistake can still be spotted in QQi desktop and mobile.  That's not to say everything is perfect with this app now - there are still the odd bugs, translation isn't perfect (though to be honest, no one yet gets it right most of the time, let alone all of the time) and you do still got odd issues with being locked out of your account.  Overall: Not yet perfect, but a huge step in the right direction!
bestReview.title: QQi steps into the modern age!

bestReview.comment: Preferable to other match games, Marvel PQDR brings incredibly fun, and dynamic additions to such a genre.  The in game play is flawless, and the graphics are impeccable.  The different character choices make for fun variations in game play outcomes, however the iso upgrade costs can get very high if you wish to pursue high level characters.    Tournaments add a wonderful degree of competition, but beware, the competition can be fierce, with high level characters at every turn.  So unless you have a lot of time, money, or both, be careful in how you spend your gold coins, iso, and especially boosters.  I suggest a large collection of boosters if you want a significant advantage in tournament play.   All round, this game is pleasing to play, runs smooth as silk, and more than anything, is a wonderful and welcome change to the predictable nature that has become the genre of matching games.

worstReview.comment: While the forecast information is generally spot-on, a number of poor choices in the display layout make this app tedious to use.  There's no way to tune the app's weather alert sensitivity or to turn it off so it always shows the alarm icon because of, say, surfing conditions, rather than the rain/cloudy/shine icon that most people will want to see. The DashClock widget assumes I'm more interested in the geographic location than the weather. The city shows up in large, easily visible text. The temperature and forecast are in the smaller, harder to read text and tend to be too verbose. For example the weather range is shown as "daily high x at 1PM low of y at 7PM" with no way to have it show the much simpler "range: x to y" that you'd want at a quick glance). And there's no way to re-order the paragraph of DashClock text to put what you want first.  A simpler form like "X degrees, overcast" as a header and the daily range in small text would be more useful. As would the ability to have DashClock not always show the "!" icon triggered by high surf weather alerts. I really want to like this app for the accuracy and overall look. But it's too hard to use as a weather-at-glance app.
worstReview.title: Accurate data but poor display
worstReview.replyText: Thanks for the feedback. The dashclock extension does need some work, as it has basically been the same since the first couple iterations [made as a bonus, versus the main interface]. I'll try to get some improvements in soon.

worstReview.comment: Awesome app!  After happily using the FREE File Manager (Explorer) for 2 years, I finally invested in the PRO version so I could eliminate the ads.  It's a good thing that I did NOT delete the FREE version immediately after installing the PRO version because the PRO version installs as a SEPARATE app -- BUT with just its default settings (i.e., it does NOT migrate any of your FREE version settings/preferences).  While it's pretty easy to re-do your custom ordering of Toolbar icons, if you have a lot of in-app Bookmarks (I have 25 & half of them with a custom name), you're going to have a lot of work to remember & re-create them (IF you kept the FREE version, you can refer back to what you had.  IF you did NOT, you're going to feel ripped off that this wasn't made clear in  the developer's description of the PRO version).  I e-mailed the developer about this issue but he replied (within minutes!) that there is currently NO way to migrate settings/preferences. His offer to CONSIDER adding this functionality to a future release, while encouraging, doesn't help anyone who decides to invest in the PRO version until then. Take app-settings SCREENSHOTS now......just in case.
worstReview.title: Awesome App BUT.......

Troop vs defense is horribly in accurate. Put in my troops and enemy defense, said I would win in 10 sec. I knew time was off due to distance of buildings. Said I would lose 40%, WRONG! It will never know because it does not know how the buildings are placed. Don't waste your time, you could figure it out yourself better.
worstReview.title: Garbage!
worstReview.replyText: Of course, you did it yourself much better. But one question: How can you decide either upgrade your dragon one more step or upgrade your Barack for PEKKA? Which one is much better for spending 2mil elixir? When you use calculator you can decide, easily for your priorities.

bestReview.comment: A must have tool for any clasher. A big thumbs up to devs for following up with an issue I had which has since been resolved with the most recent update.
